title: Poor Appointment System!
body: I waited for over half an hour on the phone to eventually talk to the person at the other end who told me there are no other appointments and I should seek a walk in centre! Other times I have waited with the call count down, for the line to go dead when its my turn. Not impressed at all!

title: Poor service
body:
Upon having ultrasound performed on Monday, the 26th of June and being told that I would need to contact Oak Hall Surgery within one to 2 days for a result on testicle cancer. I contacted Oak Hall Surgery to be told that my results were at the surgery and that the GP would give me a call, this still didn’t happen by Wednesday, the 28th of June, so I contacted Oak Hall Surgery again to be told that the results had not yet reached the surgery. 
It is now Friday, the 7th of July and still no call from Oak Hall Surgery. I am at a loss with this
I attended Buckland hospital yesterday, the 6th of July to have my testes checked by the doctor to find out he had not received any ultrasound results. 
For obvious reasons I am not happy with Oak hall with this service.

title: Late response
body: I visited this surgery 3 times because of my problems, they are good to give you an appointment, but after that nothing any response about your problem or any treatment about your health, after a I visited the gp he told me ok you need to visit a specialist but after three  months I haven't received any letter or

title: Bad experience
body: I have had a pain in my abdomen for several months. I requested an appointment with the GP for the interpretation of the ultrasound. I was directed to a nurse who specializes in abdominal pain, but when I got there I found out that she does not have this competence and must consult a Gp.Time list

title: Appalling
body: This is just awful. I've been on my specialist medication for @ 10 months, with a delivery every 2 months. Fine in theory, but this is the 3rd time they have messed up. They confirmed delivery, then didn't deliver and denied that they'd even sent the confirmation the first time. Same the second time over Christmas and now despite confirmation of delivery 2 weeks ago, they now say they don't know when and it could be 5 days after the day I'm supposed to inject. They said they requested prescriptions when the hospital confirms they haven't. Infact it's just professional gaslighting of patients and and absolute failure of service. The NHS should not waste our money on this shambles.

author: wearingqp59
title: I would like to place on record my thanks
body:
I would like to place on record my thanks to Mr. McBreaty + his team for a painless procedure which I had. I hope I will see his team on my next visit - really an excellent team  
Also the after care nurse who supplied the tea & biscuits.  
Thank you all.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Michelle2304
title: Attempting to get my suicidal friend some crisis support
body: Left 2 voicemails requesting crisis intervention. No call back. Will need to go through GP instead to get to this team. I imagine it's severely understaffed.

author: Patient at Linden
title: Feling ignored
body:
I have been seeing a GP @ Linden Medical Centre, since Sept-22 due to skin condition and in April-23 due to what I believe was an incorrect diagnosis, my condition worsened where I could not go into work or leave the house.  
The medication prescribed made the skin condition worse, so I asked for a referral letter to get properly treated via private health. The GP provided a letter without any facts, without any medication they had prescribed, and filled with opinion which I feel would not assist the Consultant.  
I wrote a number of times to query this and to get a referral letter with facts and list of medication they had prescribed and the impact it had on my skin but to date they have refused saying I should do my own letter . We are now in July-23 and I am unable to get treated for my condition.  
I feel the GP and the General manager have been uncaring/unhelpful and simply do not understand the pain and agony I have had to go through along with purchasing all the medication since Sept-22 which has not worked or given me a bad reaction on my skin. I find the GP is very arrogant when attending appointments and had asked for the last 2 appointments for another GP but told this was not possible. When attending the appointments they seem uninterested and was always clock watching even though I was usually out within 5-10mins.  
To date no apology, no update when I will get a professional medical referral letter even though sending emails but they are being ignored.

author: wateret63
title: Great GPs but upsetting treatment at reception
body:
Repeated instances of being left having a meltdown or at minimum, in tears of frustration after dealing with reception. Feels like they are being deliberately obtuse to restrict access. Even when explaining my health needs, which include communication difficulties, they still do things like interrupt, talk over, patronise and confuse me, as well as calling me the wrong name. They behave this way over the phone and in person.  
I appreciate that there is a strain on resources but some patience and empathy with patients would go a long way. It takes me weeks to work up the courage to call the GP because of how I know the reception staff will be, and without fail every time I am left in tears and usually the rest of the day is a write off. Because of my health issues, interactions with the receptionist have left me feeling so bad I have felt like hurting myself due to how anxious and upset it makes me.  
The GPs and the nurses I have seen in the practice, however, have been fantastic. They are brilliant at listening and supporting. They have been fantastic at helping me access the support I need. I have no complaints whatsoever regarding their care.

readBy.name: Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: trapperyr77
title: Patient Doctor access
body:
Over the last eighteen months or so several conditions developed resulting in several visits to my local health centre. On each visit I saw a different doctor, often a locum.  
As some conditions worsened I started to feel I was losing control of my situation as there was no one person who had a clear picture of who I was as a person or patient. Apart from my health, my driving licence could possibly be withdrawn.  
I made an appointment with a named doctor, explaining I needed to discuss my concerns. In the event, it could not have been better. Each issue was tackled in turn and a plan going forward made.

author: caringrw34
title: I don't think I'd still be here if it wasn't for them.
body:
Its been lonely and frustrating over the last 3 years since being referred to Rheumatology. I've become so ill that my life has shut down. I can't work, I've stopped all classes and physical activity, I hardly socialise, I don't have a full relationship with my husband anymore.  
Until now there was no email or phone number - no way of getting through! Every appointment is like the first one! A new nurse or doctor with no knowledge of me, no experience, no ideas! Nothing has been done to diagnose me - dangerous immune suppressants are recommended with no evidence or diagnosis!  
Luckily immunology (Derriford) and Haematology became involved when I ended up in ER and they are helping - I don't think I'd still be here if it wasn't for them.

author: romeohj85
title: We need to make this better for everyone and soon
body:
I’ve been struggling with depression and anxiety for a while. Recently, I’ve experienced a sudden worsening of my anxiety symptoms and started to endure frequent, intense panic attacks. I’m super aware at the moment of the pressures on NHS services and staffing levels and I very rarely ever reach out for help. Despite my best efforts to manage my current situation independently, I felt I had no option other than to contact my gp practice.  
As a patient, receiving regular texts from my practice that there is either no gp cover or reduced staffing levels - always makes me feel that I shouldn’t bother anyone and I honestly would only contact them if absolutely necessary. I don’t find it easy to speak about my mental health but the panic attacks have gotten so frequent I’m worried it will affect my ability to attend work, so I called the practice.  
I’d spoken with a GP a couple of days earlier about a medication change, to help manage my current exacerbation. On collecting my prescription I noticed that the medication had been reduced, instead of increased as discussed and agreed. I thought this would be a simple error and tried to raise this with a patient advisor (receptionist).  
I tried to explain the situation and apologise for contacting again but that I was worried this would lead to a worsening of my already unmanageable condition. The patient advisor was very dismissive and abrupt. They began telling me that I had already just had a medication review and I would have to give the medication time to work.  
I reiterated that I didn’t think they had caught what I was trying to explain and that rather than increase the medication as agreed, I believed it had been reduced in error. I was then told that I was taking the maximum dose (despite this being incorrect) and again that I would just have to manage the situation myself.  
The patient advisor had zero empathy for my situation. I was made to feel like a nuisance and despite trying to explain that I was really struggling and would need someone to clarify this for me. I was then told bluntly someone would call me nearly 3 weeks later - the earliest opportunity.  
Normally I have always had amazing care from my GP practice and last year they helped save my life when I was unaware how unwell I was and required emergency surgery. However this week when trying to access support for my mental health, it has been the most embarrassing and shaming experience, making me feel like I can’t reach out during a crisis.  
I appreciate anxiety and panic attacks are not life threatening but despite trying all of the self care advice that is on NHS inform and having sought specialist mental health advice from other NHS services I was following the advice to have an urgent medication review.  
I’d just also like to highlight that at no point this week has anyone explored any thoughts of harm. My anxiety has gotten so bad it’s left me feeling at my absolute worst. Suicidal thoughts have been overwhelming at times and this is absolutely out of character for me.  
I’m not someone who complains and for me I have a voice and feel I am able to politely challenge poor care but I would like to highlight how difficult it is to pick up the telephone, to discuss mental health. Especially when you know there’s every chance there are no gp’s or nurses available to help. Also that when experiencing a mental health crisis people may be overwhelmed and at their lowest point. Quite possibly experiencing thoughts and/or acts of harm.  
Not listening to patients, fobbing them off, being rude and dismissive is not helpful to anyone and especially not when facing mental health challenges. I now fully understand why many people do not reach out to discuss mental health.  
I genuinely feel that NHS GG&C must look to improve staffing levels at GP practices. I feel that it is a patient safety issue not having adequate staffing levels, to assess patients. Further, to extend the importance of understanding it takes a great deal of courage to reach out. We don’t expect patient advisors to be mental health experts but listening to patients, considering basic risk and not dismissing genuine concerns will save lives.  
I can’t wait for a week where I don’t receive a text message telling me that our practice has no staff available, reduced staff or reduced hours.  
I am a proud supporter and advocate of our precious NHS and I am forever thankful for staff working hard under unforeseen conditions but please, please we need to make this better for everyone and soon.

title: Superb service
body: I went to pharmacy for BP check. It was found to be very high, so pharmacist arranged for a doctor to see me. This took about 10 minutes! I was given medication to save me going to A&E, and covering arrangements made. I went home very happy and feeling much better! Nothing was too much trouble, and they have been very good all during the pandemic! Well done Downlands!

title: Reliable practice with excellent team
body:
This is my second feedback, given how easy they have made looking after two young kids' medical needs and staying on top of their medical records. 

Nothing is too much for the practice team; no question is silly or obvious. They will guide you with care and empathy. They helped me link my kids' medical profile to my own profile with the NHS app; now, I don't have to worry about immunisation records, appointment/hospital letters, or test results; everything is there. 

I want to say thank you for relating my problem and, above all, resolving it so quickly.

title: Waste of space on Planet Earth.
body:
I had an appointment at 09:20 for my asthma review. 
I made arrived to the front desk at 09:36.
They booked me in, and asked me to wait. 
At 10:04, I checked again with front desk manager to make sure I am being registered. 
At 10:06 she tells me that the doctor wants me to rebook because I was late and she cannot fit me in. 
We are lucky that creatures such as this doctor/nurse didn't come in direct contact with me. Anyway, I will not reschedule, and let's see how this matter will end. I'm intrigued. 
Rammah

title: Poor accessibility to services for chronic…
body: Have tried and tried to get an appointment for an asthma review. Used the modality system for a time and date. Never honoured (no phone call at the time I was told). Tried again with time and date available online. Received a text to say a phone call would be made on a day I was working (clinically) and not available. I texted back with this information only to receive a text saying my case was closed? Appalling.

title: Băd services
body: First of all I had my appointment at 10:20 but it’s 10:50 and I’m still waiting saying to me that the doctor couldn’t handle the time and it’s behind now but it’s happening all the time that I have appointment here. Secondly, last time after waiting half an hour they asked me 2 question without even care about my problem. Unexperienced doctors

title: Quick and speedy blood test
body:
Thank you to the nurse today who took my bloods.

During other blood tests (not just at this surgery) I have been told I have difficult veins to find, and have come out with multiple blood bruises on both arms. But today the nurse was efficient, speedy and I was in and out within a couple of minutes. You are perhaps one of the quickest blood tests I have had! Thank you to this nurse, I hope you have a nice time at Gunwarf.

Currently, attending this surgery in person or having non agreed/pre-arranged phone calls or having to call back reception after I have missed a doctor's call (that was not agreed/pre-arranged) triggers anxiety and heightened panic attacks. Today, this nurse showed that once you can access the service, it should be okay.

Thank you.

title: Great service
body:
Did Klinik request at 8.30am Phone call from GP and antibiotics prescribed and started by 10.45. What fantastic service I know that you are all under great stress with volume of your workload but the Klinik system seems to work well I don’t think some patients understand the concept of triage and so they get frustrated that they haven’t had a call . I’ve had great service today and on several other occasions , I just hope I don’t have to bother you again any time soon 
Thankyou to all

title: Unacceptable
body:
Having called the surgery twice this week to try and book a routine appointment, on both occasions i missed out as the small amount of non urgent appointments had gone. I was advised to go into the surgery and try booking the appointment face-to-face but I was again unsuccessful. I asked how I could complain and was directed to the complaints section on the website but this resulted in an error message. 
I appreciate the NHS are struggling and are understaffed but before I moved to this area I was part of a surgery that operated amazingly and where you could always get an appointment. I fail to understand how Crawley Down Health Centre can't do the same. The appointment booking system is shocking and needs urgent review. I, like many others, could have an underlying condition or something wrong but I can't get an appointment to be seen. Its frustrating and unacceptable

title: appalling
body: appointments are impossible to get. Sat in telephone queue for over an hour at 19th in queue which didn't change. In that time I have driven to the surgery from work. with my phone still on hold to walk into the surgery and find 2 receptions chatting over cups of coffee, no one in waiting area and no phone ringing?? if you complain their attitude is 'go somewhere else' I know of at least 2 people who have died due to late diagnosis of cancer due to this. They have apparently taken on an extra 3000 patients. Why do this if you don't have the capacity to deal with the patients you already have. There are more reception staff than doctors, and the doctors only work part time. My partner is told by doctor to come back in 7 days for cancer results, 21 days later and he just manages to get a telephone appointment. My daughter is pregnant but unable to get a referral for a scan and I need to discuss operation aftercare but am not allowed to see my doctor as appoints are already booked up to 2 weeks in advance. it is akin to a 3rd world country medical care. The practice manager has turned a local village doctors into a total disgrace. Still trying to blame everything on Covid but the truth is it was already going downhill fast. More interested in funding than medical care. Total breaches of gdpr with reception staff and failure to abide by hypocratic oath from the doctors. They need a full investigation by someone doing a secret shopper role. Online portals don't work for many patients but it seems that the ones who mange to have got it take a majority over the appointments as there are very few released for telephone booking. (i believe it is 3) They do not cater for people who work as you need to ring every day at 8.30am and stay in queue for an hour to be told all appointments have gone and to try again tomorrow. Same and repeat. Killing the nhs as people will choose to go private for the sake of their health when there are serious issues. Referrals are impossible to get. Took me 2 years to get one from GP and then hospital can see me and book in operation in a matter of months so it is GP who is causing backlogs.  Serious investigations are needed into this practice as it is all about the money and how much they can claim from the government rather than offer any quality care.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: appointment system needs attention
body:
The eye care examinations were first class, well explained and understandable.
However the booking system is a shambles.  At least five text messages variously inviting an appointment to be made, two emails, after making appointment another arrived,via text, a mobile call after appointment a letter arrived after the appointment , given the state of the postal service ,can I suggest that a letter dated and presumable posted the day before is, somewhat ridiculous, given that it includes answers to common questions listed in general faq's
 The second appointment someone called via landline, anappointment made, but, I continued to receive ,via text, invitations to make an appointment.  I attended the second appointment on July 6th This morning July 7th I get, through the post an appointment letter for July 6th. The contact telephone number is useless, there's never anyone to answer.   
Im fairly certain that technology will be blamed, but surely, somehere, somehow, it can be co-ordinated.
Linda Mussett ...       site attended Metrocenre Gateshed

title: Terrible communication
body: When I left accident and emergency after I broke a bone in my foot I was given a paper notifying me I had a follow up phone consultation booked for Friday. The next day I received an email informing me I had an in-person appointment for the same time. I was pleased and made babysitter arrangements and took a taxi in the day. When I arrived they told me it was a “technical glitch” and my appointment was indeed virtual. So now I am sitting outside of the hospital, and it is 15 minutes past the time for either of those appointments, and I haven’t spoken to anyone virtually or been seen, and I wasted my money and time, to make my difficult way here with a broken foot for nothing.

title: Awful
body: Booked an appointment because of my ongoing struggles with my hyper mobility and currently really struggling to go to my gp surgery.. 3 appointments I had this week and all cancelled because of “overrun of appointments”. Extremely angry and disappointed.

title: Used to be brilliant
body: What’s going on? Unable to book a telephone appointment or speak to anyone due to Black Alert. Whatever that is. Unbelievable. I just want a simple answer to simple question. Not a lengthy waiting phone call to 111. Just gone from bad to worse.

title: soft Tissue Injection Service Do Not Answer Phone
body: contacted them on the 19th of june they said they will be back to me with an appointment by the 29th of june, but they have not contacted me. Phoned every day this week but they do not answer the phone.  Spoke to the doctors reception they said that they would pass on a message, but 3 days later no one has contacted me.

title: Excellent and first class and caring service
body: On the 12 th June 2023  around 8 am my mother was admitted to hospital. I am her full time caregiver and I called the ambulance. The whole experience was made easier with such lovely and caring staff. The ambulance staff Dom, Andrew, Sadie. They made my mother and I feel so blessed to have such a reassuring and supportive journey to the hospital. Don even checked up on my mother while we were waiting in the accident and emergency area. My mother said he looked like a film star and he put a smile on her face , which was so heartwarming. Such a kind young man. She stayed for four days in the Charing Cross hospital. From the emergency staff, doctors and nurses I can only praise their profession care and expertise. I felt my mother was in safe and caring hands all the way through her stay. My mother is recovering and it’s thanks to her exceptional care from all the kind staff at Charing Cross. My mother and myself are truly grateful for your kindness and care. Wishing you the best and a Big Thank You for all your excellent and hard work.

title: Worst GP Practice Ever Been Registered With
body:
I have been unhappy with the service from this practice since I registered 3 years ago. The reception staff are unfriendly and unhelpful. Some of the doctors, not all, are totally disinterested and act like they can't wait for you to leave even though you only have 10 minutes with them.  When you phone, after holding on for as much as 25 minutes at times, I never feel listened to or that anyone tries to help.

I work for the NHS and go out of my way to help patients so I honestly cannot understand this treatment.  I called today, held on for ages, got a call back from a totally cold and rude woman.  She was extremely unhelpful so I basically told her to forgot it and put the phone down in frustration.  Where do they recruit these people from I wonder?

I am done with this practice and will now finally move to another.

title: Gives a bad name to good physio
body:
Just awful.
Several texts and phone calls over the course of a day to get me to fill out the endless questionnaires that don’t always contain the info you need to input.
One telephone consultation later with me repeating the same info, I was asked to go in. They then ask the same questions at your appointment! Then they give a short examination and send you on your way telling you they will email an exercise plan. Physio without being shown what to do is useless. I have a chronic condition, I’ve been under physio several times before and have always found it helpful. This time I am sure I made my pain worse but not completing the exercises correctly.
Then they ask to see you in 4 weeks….. except there aren’t any appointments available in 4 weeks! They kept requesting that I travel to the next location which is difficult for me to do with my problem. I told them I couldn’t keep taking time off work to come in the middle of the day by they can’t seem to ever provide Morning or late afternoon appointments. I was referred to them again this year and I’ve declined. It’s just a shambles. Physio does not work without face to face guidance and examples. I wish Connect Health would look at all the 1 star reviews here and take notice of how terribly their patients are being treated. But I don’t think they will, as at the end of the day, several boroughs now only use Connect health for NHS physio referrals so they’re getting the all the business without having to improve patient care.

title: Unanswered Calls
body: I've struggled to get through to anyone at the Rheumatology Department, no one takes calls and I've been leaving answerphone messages for weeks.  I've just managed to get through to a Secretary who says hopefully someone will get back to me. I have a debilitating joint disease, I really shouldn't have to live on hope to get a repeat prescription!

title: Do not join this practice
body:
If you want a live example of how far the National Health Service has fallen, this is the place for you.

Totally overrun surgery (you stand more chance of winning the lottery than of getting an appointment on the phone at 8am) with utterly indifferent receptionists and doctors who don't fulfil their callback duties. Do not, and I repeat, do not join this surgery. Go literally anywhere else. Ignore this advice and you will bitterly regret it. That is a guarantee. 

I was suffering for days and was fobbed off with the usual, "It's probably viral, sip fluids, take paracetamol." No wonder A & E is overrun.

title: Appointment system.
body: Why are we unable to go into the surgery in person and make an appointment? Husband queued in reception, details taken, then told, no, you must make a telephone appointment. What a waste of time, for both the receptionist and my husband. What is the rational for this? As users of this practice we were unaware of this. You need to be fully functioning just to get over the first hurdle, that is get an appointment. By virtue of the fact we are needing to see a doctor, why make it so difficult. Telephone calls frequently tell you that you are in double digits in the queue, which can take forever to clear. That is if your call is not weirdly cut off. It is obvious that there are not enough staff to deal with these very important, emotional calls. Or the system is not dealing with them efficiently. It is of no surprise then that patients take themselves off to the overburdened A&E departments in desperation.Please get the basics in place, good communication.

title: my doctor
body: So easy to get to see a doctor, always happy faces from the doctors, and reception. Alway leave the surgery feeling they have looked after me. I'm nearly 80 so it's important they give the right advice

title: Cancelled my appointment for no reason
body: It's almost impossible to make an appointment. Phone line appears dead. I see a different doctor everytime I am able to make a appointment. None of them know my medical history and all seem very clueless with most issues and refer to Google for answers. For my mental health I was simply told to call Minds Matter after waiting two weeks to speak to a doctor. My last appointment which I had the physically visit the practice to make, was cancelled by text a week later for no reason and was told to re arrange it. Again, that was for a mental health issue. With all the suicides recently, you'd think they'd be a bit more professional and helpful... Not at all... the management of this practice this needs seriously looking at and re staffing and the phone service needs sorting. It's s Joke!! and causing patients more stress!

title: Great Hospital
body: I and my wife spent two nights at the fortgill Block ward 2 of Good hope hospital and I have to say that the staff were really helpful and they treated us with respect and care. Thanks to all nurses and doctors at this hospital. You are all angels and amazing. ❤️

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible
body: I’ve been waiting all day for my phone consultation and even rang back just before closing for lunch to be told the doctor will ring me soon, the practice is now closed and I can’t get hold of anyone this is extremely stressful and unprofessional

title: Unhappy
body: Requested medication on 23rd June it is now July and as yet not received prescription.I have already run out of two of my tablets.

title: Dietary
body: I go to the transplant clinic @Derby hospital for my follow up. However they do not have a dietitian so I have had to speak to my brother for advice. They need to have one in my opinion.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb service
body: I phoned surgery at 8:20 for an appointment for husband , waited 30 secs for a response. Appointment with staff member at 9:30 am , staff member who husband saw was very good , gave husband time , very attentive and husband did not feel rushed. I am very pleased with service that was recieved. Thank you fakenham

title: Now
body: too long after event for accurate comment but can say that service has deteriorated. Re. previous question I do not make recommendations.

title: therapist left
body: Had a therapist who was in training , loads of cancelled appointments or would change such short notice because of training, or illness and I was left waiting on a zoom meeting only for me to email to find out due to illness. Therapist left now haven’t had any sessions for 2 weeks, I have a Asd Child so I have explained numerous times my schedule and my routine, the therapy 4you plus team should have got back and I landed chasing as I really need those sessions right now. I waited over a year for this now to be left with nothing till someone can see me, my anxiety with new people and relationships bonding is stressing me out, it’s a shambles the system. Maybe monitor the trainees more and look at their schedule if they have patients booked in and not cancel last minute,also the score qu air take in to consideration people might get confused if dyslexic additional needs, my scores was still the same after 12 sessions only because we went over them. Mental health is not a joke and you treat us patients as the Jokers!!!

readBy.name: Essex Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Clinic & Nurses
body:
Went for blood pressure test, nurse found other problem and said i had to get to hospital immediately. Problem was dealt with by Southport Hospital with wonderful service.
The Clinic at Manor Primary Care was excellent.

title: Not good patient contact
body:
I am due for hernia repair cannot get in touch with general surgery department to confirm referral is being dealt with and/or when because I am in constant discomfort 
Poor patient services

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice all round
body: I visited the surgery yesterday feeling quite unwell and the young doctor I saw couldn't have been more helpful or sympathetic. She asked all the right questions  and even phoned me at home later with an appointment for blood tests.  Excellent service. I've been with this practice for over 50 years.  Wonderful service from the moment you walk in.  Gold star for receptionists too!!

title: Finally given up and am moving Surgeries
body: I have been with this surgery for over 30 years and it has got worse and worse to the point where it is now appalling. You cannot get an appointment at 8 even after queuing for over an hour, you cannot now book a non emergency appointment so it is impossible to get to see a doctor. I used my full data allocation on 1 day queing for 1.5 hours at 8 then again at 2 and still couldnt get an appointment. They have lost my daughters bloods, given us incomplete prescriptions, failed to follow advice given by a hospital doctor, completely failed in their duty of care to my son . Enough is enough surely another surgery has to be better than this

title: Disappointing
body:
I’ve been with this GP practise for nearly 30 years. For starters, the physical ambience is the most unwelcoming it has ever been resembling an unkempt warehouse. On my most recent visit the place wreaked of urine - possibly after the result of an accident in the waiting area which was simply covered with tissue paper. Nobody seemed bothered to clean it up!
The reception service is hit and miss possibly due to the high turnover of staff. However, even with the “experienced” back room staff, it was very difficult to get a simple blood test order printed. Furthermore, I was also given incorrect information on where and when to get the blood test done which I only discovered after deciding to google the information myself. 
Finally and in all fairness, if you get through to one of the resident (not locum) GPs you tend to generally receive a good service at that point.

title: Great practice, rude nurse
body: The nurse made me feel stupid and like an idiot. Not polite and didn't listen. I asked several questions that she didn't answer or changed the subject. I felt her to be quite aggressive in her manner.  I am a helth care person and would not treat my patients like that, bad day or not

title: Totally inadequate
body: After waiting well over a year for an initial appointment and having chased the matter several times, I finally received a letter inviting me to make an appointment. When I tried to do this, there were no appointments available. No explanation. Meanwhile, my whole body is increasingly leaning to one side, as a result, putting pressure on my spine, hips and knees. System does not even enable me to find a resolution.

title: Great Service
body: I have had a blood test done today and am really happy with the service and staff. I didn’t have to wait for my turn. Everything was quick and convenient

title: These problems need sorting
body: Sadly over the last few weeks I have lost even more confidence in this surgery. You can't get an appointment however when I go up there there isn't a person to be see?? Reception isn't always manned which gives the impression they are either short staffed or don't want to face the patients. I had 2 hospital letters sent to them, one in April and one in May and when I submitted my prescription request in May they still hadn't updated my dose adjustments. The website has the wrong opening hours on it, surely you can't get this wrong. This surgery needs to wind back a few years when things were so much more efficient. Please don't worry about responding with excuses, use your time on improving this practise and take on board all the negative reviews!

title: Efficient
body: Had an issue with my elderly mother. Surgery was prompt, helpful, and efficient.  Phoned when they said...actually earlier. Kind, considerate

title: Poor service
body: No appointments available when needed even when it's an emergency. Receptionists arnt that helpful and don't really care if you need help. Lack of care from this service

title: Horrible
body:
A relative of mine has severe chest pains, had an ECG at the hospital.
All clear, but told to get a blood test. Called in at surgery in agony, no words to describe the receptionist attitude, left in tears. 0/10

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Helpful staff
body:
Very professional and helpful doctor in charge. Reception staff and nurses courteous and diligent.
Sometimes, when calling the practice, the wait time on the phone can be long, but when visiting in person I receive prompt attention.

title: Very poor service received!
body: I went to my scan appointment this afternoon. The receptionist told me to wait to be called however, I have not been called instead someone else been seen. There was another lady came and knocked on the door and said that she is early for her 3pm appointment. The scanner said that I was late for my appointment even though, I don’t. She asked me to wait until she finish scanning all the 5 patients. She is very rude and told me that she will not scan. I felt very insulted in front of others. I am very disappointed the way I treated at the appointment.

title: Disorganised & Drespectful
body:
My GP referred me to this service.
I missed their initial call, they left a voicemail requesting I email them to organise my appointment but no email address was provided. I called back via the number that called me but there was no answer. My GP then provided me with their number and I rang back and was breaded for not having a referral number. I was disrespected and not awarded any courtesy (common or otherwise) and was refused an appointment. I was left in tears and ultimately I knew my wellbeing and health, physical or mental would not be prioritised if I were to attend any appointments     with Lakeside Medical Diagnostics.
As a person of colour I can only imagine what my treatment would have been if I had come face to face with any of the staff there.

title: Wonderful staff
body:
Fantastic from start to finish. Receptionist was lovely.
My sonographer and his assistant were both brilliant. Friendly, reassuring, had a bit of a laugh and a joke while still being super professional. I arrived early (2.30) which the assistant saw and acknowledge, told me sha had one person waiting before me. I was out before my appointment was even due (2.45) who could ask for more!! Just wish I hadn’t paid for two hours parking in Westminster 😂

title: Everyone really helpful.
body: Doctor new what he was on about,and made sure all my med’s were up to date.tuck my blood pressure and booked me in for a blood test

title: Administration ineffeciency
body:
I had a hearing test in February 2023 following a consultation with the ENT doctor in December 2022. I  was referred to the Audiology service at Whipps Cross to be fitted with a hearing aid.
After several weeks I was told to attend the drop in clinic at Whipps so I attended that clinic on Tuesday 30th May.  The audiologist was extremely helpful and agreed that he would order hearing aids for myself and I would contacted with an appointment.   As I have not heard anything from that department,  I sent an email and was told I was on the waiting list for an appointment to be fitted with hearing aids.  The initial appoint with the ENT department was on 24th December 2022 and I am still waiting to have my hearing aids.  I realise it is not a life or death situation but I cannot believe that I am waiting for so many months.  I have received various duplicate emails with conflicting messages.  I hope that something can be done for me to be given an appointment soon and would hope that someone would look into this matter.

title: Avoid at all costs
body: Never in my life had to deal with unhelpful, uneducated jumped up receptionists in my life. I will be calling in for a face to face with the member in question. Disgusting!!!!!

title: Coming up short
body: I have been on the phone for 20 minutes and still waiting the service is terrible it was the same in the morning I need to book a psa blood test as I have recently had my prostrate removed so I need to keep a eye on my psa blood count with not being able to get through it is a trying time for me so I don’t need to be worrying about being left on the phone waiting for the surgery to get round to answering the phone

title: Great practice , reliable
body: Appreciate our surgery so much. Never let us down. Have always been heard and actually listened too. A plan of action is ways put in place, and a back up of first suggestion fails. Realy lovley doctors, love seeing the oldies (long serving members of staff). Receptionist are friendly. The telephone service has improved, don't be annoyed to hear your number 30 in the que, it drops quickly. The online consult forms are quick, and any admin queries are dealt with pretty speedy. Wait rooms are clear bright and spacious . Can't nominate a chemist so prescriptions automatically get sent across. Recommended surgery 100%

title: I can’t thank you enough
body:
To the Staff of A & E and Jevington Ward. 
I can not thank you enough for nursing me back to health. Not all Superheroes wear capes. From my diagnosis in A & E to the care and attention on Jevington Ward 5*

title: Bad receptionist
body: Phoned for repeat prescription to be sent to pharmacy in an emergency. But receptionist wasn't very helpful saying she can't promise that I will receive my medication.

title: Avoid, shocking attitude of doctors
body:
Locum doctors, often rude when asked for explanation about the treatment / condition (simple stuff, nothing too elaborate or scientific). The doctor will only consult on one matter i.e. if you come with one problem (e.g. persistent cough) they would not help you with another condition (e.g. thrush). The doctor doesn't even want to hear about this. 
The above has happened to me on a number of occasions. The attitude of doctors is shocking.
The reception staff is ok.

title: Fab service
body: I did have a long wait( around 6 weeks) for my appointment although when the day arrived I completely lost track of time and arrived 25mins late. I still attended, if nothing else to apologise profusely, and see if they were running behind. The 2 ladies on reception were extremely helpful and offered to send a message to see if I could still be seen. I was seen after the next patient and was very grateful. Thank you for a fab service

title: Practice is fine
body: Doctors and staff are great i don't like the way you have to book appointments and can’t book appointments in advance to see a doctor

author: normaex87
title: Mental health support for my son
body:
My 16 year old son was trying to climb out his bedroom window at midnight to go out with his friends.  
He has ASD and I was very concerned about his vulnerabilities in making impulsive decisions and not being honest with us.  
He’s already in trouble with the police, I feel he’s struggling with the changes coming his way as he’s left school and has no plans for the next 2 months.  
I have tried to get support but really struggled to get the help we need, I have arranged private counselling for him.  
Having come into A&E, I’ve not felt supported as a parent and we have been waiting for CAMHS for over 7 hours.  
I feel that the system to support mental health is failing our young people.  
I feel so alone and let down, it’s like there is prevention to help before my son does something to either harm himself or someone else, we don’t feel safe around him as a family.

title: Cracking medical centre
body: I joined blandford on Friday the 30th of June 2023 and just one week forward, friday the 7th of july 2023, the kindness and care the wonderful staff have given to me is very much appreciated, as I'm suffering from mental health issues resulting from the loss of loved ones and a couple of annoying physical issues from a heart attack, so I just wanted to say, a humongous thank you to all the staff at blandford and also for your patience and understanding with me as well, and not forgetting the efficiency and speed in getting me registered at your lovely medical centre, once again a massive thank you to you all.

title: Not impressed
body: I have been a paitent at Bramley Health and welbeing centre all my life ( was previously highfield medical centre). I have a long term condition and take daily medication. For the last year I have had so many issues with repeat presciptions not being sent the pharmacy. This has promted me to have to contact the surgery and dwell in the long wait times waiting for my call to be taken. I have been given incorrect information ( your prescrition has been sent, the doctor will sort within the hr ect) today i have had to ring the surgery 3 times and my presciption is still not sorted, i am currently on a transplant list and it is essential i get my medication to remain as healthy as possible in case i get a call to go on for my kidney transplant. I feel upset that the surgery seem to be playing at being doctors rather than helping the paitents effectivly. It needs to be addressed  as the service is really poor, the reception staff are not great. I am under a great amount of stress because of this which on my condition is not good.

title: The worst service I’ve ever experienced
body: Having been with this practice since I was a baby, I felt a huge sense of loyalty to stick with them but I’ve had enough and have now moved doctors. Hands down the last few times have been the worst experience I’ve ever encountered. Ranging from having to wait over 3 weeks for test results, asking 4 times to speak to the manager and zero contact back from her, losing paperwork, missing off blood tests I needed. The list goes on, not to mention the unprofessional rude staff, including one ‘healthcare worker’ who spoke about me in a rude aggressive manner with her door wide open not knowing I was stood there. I’ve overheard the manager slagging off members of her staff infront of patients, talking about patients and their personal information.. it’s honestly so surprising how they appear to still be running as a practice. I have also submitted a complaint to NHS England and I would urge anyone reading this to think again about trusting these people with your health, they are awful

title: Great practice, Lovely doctors, nurses
body: Been here quite a few ties and always manage to get an appointment. One thing i do not like is when you call at 8 your only offered a telephone consultation which i find ridiculous. Patients should have the option if they want a telephone appointment on the day or a face to face appointment not saying"the doctor will triage you etc" its just a waste of an appointment as following the call the GP would then book in the patient. Other than that the E consults are a great way of appointments, medication reviews etc.

title: Worst practice
body:
I attended an appointment on the 13th January with the nurse after being referred by occupational health at my work. I handed over a form given to me by occupational health to be completed by the doctor. I was told by the nurse that a doctor would have to fill in the form and it would be passed on.
After making three phone calls and being told there was no trace of this form, I called in person to be told to call back tomorrow when you would have had chance to track it down. I called in the next day and was assured it would be ready if I called back tomorrow as it was with the secretary. I called in on 10th February to be told it was not ready but I would receive a phone call later on that day when it would be ready. This never happened. 
I then phoned the practice back later on 10th February to be told it has been posted back to me to be filled in by occupational health at work. How Ludacris is this when it is occupation health at work that requested you to complete it in the first place.

After a visit to accident and emergency on 29th January I was diagnosed with a torn meniscus. I was told this would take a minimum of 6 to 12 weeks to recover from. I then self-certified for the first seven days.
On the 6th February I phoned the practice to request a fit note.
I was told I needed to have a telephone consultation with the doctor before this could be issued and I would receive a phone call from the doctor, this never happened.
Then a text was sent to me on 8th February with a link for the fit note.
I phoned the practice on the same day to say I need a paper copy as I do not have the necessary i.t. equipment to deal with this. 
I was told to call in the practice on 9th February to pick it up. I called in and was told it was not ready but I would get a phone call in the morning to confirm it was ready. This never happened.
I then called in on the 10th February and was told it was not ready but I would receive a phone call later on that day when it would be ready. This never happen.

I then received a text requesting further information regarding the fit note. I then phoned the practice and was told you wanted to know the dates of the fit note (bearing in mind this had already been completed and sent electronically.) I was then told there had been some confusion over the fit note but it should be ready by the 13th January.
How difficult is it for a general practice to issue a fit note?

I have been repeatedly fobbed off and purposely lied too.
This whole situation has been shambolic. This practice is a disgrace to your profession.

title: Diabetic review
body:
I had diabetic checks on April 19th,
June 27th and a call back with results on July 4th.
Both practitioner were polite ,respectful and highly skilled,the most important thing was that they showed total commitment  to their job,giving appropriate  time to.enable me as a.patient to.engage in a 2 way conversation  about my condition.
Terrific  people skills .....a credit to the practice  .

title: Why the NHS should be treasured!
body:
I contacted the city surgery on behalf of my elderly Mum, had a bit of a cough for a while. Offered an appt next day with nurse practitioner, was unsure but referred to hospital for X-ray. Mum attended straight after leaving surgery. X-ray performed. Received phone call from surgery next day (from nurse practioner) to say X-ray had identified chest infection. Within two hours local pharmacy had delivered a course of antibiotics.

Thank you so much, NHS have shown kind caring and compassionate care to my Mum.

title: Great GP
body: Had a review with GP today. Have been referred to Respiratory team at Medway Hospital  in May with no response. The GP has contacted the consultant and requested an urgent appointment. Also had discussed my treatment with the consultant who had advised next steps.

title: Telephone wait after being first in queue
body: Waited 1hr 45 mins in queue, 1 hrs of this being the "first" in queue. If surgery has closed, why do they leave you holding on telling you that you are first in the queue "and your call is very important to us, please wait for the next available agent". This makes you think they will speak to the callers that got through before closing time. Please correct this system flaw.

title: Caring doctor
body:
Had a telephone consultation with my registered GP concerning some test results. I was a bit concerned but my doctor explained what the results meant in a language that I could understand.
He answered all my questions and by the end of the telephone call I was reassured that I had to worry about.

title: Ego, power and medicine a bad look.
body:
My most recent experience with this surgery was one that shouldn't put anyone off seeing their GP, please let me make that absolutely clear. Since this surgery merged with other surgeries there are strange gps who do not know you or 
 anything about you or your history. Like many others my own experience was by telephone and with a gp who knew little about me or my history and felt that they had to impose  opinionated views and practice upon myself with consequences which were truly and deeply alarming and disturbing affecting me deeply emotionally and physically at a time when I truly needed compassion and kindness. Perhaps they were having a really bad day but they felt the need, which I feel was driven by ego and possibly a distorted view and because they could, to change my treatment radically. This surgery used to be one of the most excellent around and hopefully things can only get better for all of us. It is so disappointing that I feel it has to be made clear to anyone reading this that they should really try to stick to the GP that they know and know well with kindness and trust. I sincerely hope that this is not the shape of things to come...

title: Unanswered e-consult
body: I submitted an e-consult on behalf of my child, requesting an asthma assessment and treatment plan. The e-consult was received by the Practice but I have not received any response from the Practice. I have been unable to get through by phone. I have visited the Practice in person to request an appointment with the asthma nurse, only to be told appointments cannot be booked directly and that a message would be passed on for the asthma nurse to contact me. This also has not happened. My only option now is to wait 4 weeks for a GP appointment. This is unnecessary and uses a GP appointment that could be used for someone else, as all we need is an asthma nurse review and treatment plan. Very disappointed but not surprised.

title: Disappointed
body:
After submitting my BP readings, as requested, they were high, the doctor offered me an additional drug to add to my current meds. That’s fine, but I have had bad reactions in the past. Her suggestion was that I present myself at A and E, where I will be given a bed and investigation into my condition.  That’s not what happens I’m afraid, I have done this before and was given a bed overnight for regular monitoring. I was not seen by any health worker all night long ,but I had the attention of the other women in the ward. One defacated on the floor next to my bed, another tried to get into bed with me, most of the others were screaming and running around ,they obviously had mental health problems..  I had to discharge myself, it was so stressful!  Not helpful , bearing in mind that I had high BP!
I have the impression that the doctor doesn’t want to treat me, just to pass me on…
It is frightening to feel that you have no medical support beyond the handing out of pills, is that the way the GP service is going I wonder…
I will treat myself, trying to keep calm and take the pills until I have a crisis, very scary situation.

title: Poor service
body: It is impossible to book an appointment over the phone, you have to use askmygp, which goes off-line 3 minutes after 8am. The instruction is to be by your phone and check emails for a response. I wait all day for a call or email. At 16:55 - almost 9 hours after my message - I received an email that says I may need to go to A&E for an assessment. No one took the time to speak to me, or even to write a coherent email explaining why I might need to go to A&E and what I should expect to happen when I got there. What is the point of a GP service if they cannot communicate to patients and only tell them to use an already overstretched alternative NHS service, such as A&E?

title: Great service
body: I was referred by my GP as I have been experiencing discomfort in the area where I had breast cancer ten years ago. All the staff at Macclesfield hospital, in the breast care department, were professional, reassuring and personable. I feel confident that I receive the best possible care in this setting.

title: Terrible Practice
body:
Absolute appalling practice I must say. I have been with Bedfont Practice all my life I'm almost 60 years old. It was once a great practice  ut over the last few years it has completely changed and changed for the worse. 
I use an inhaler and have done all my life I asked for a prescription in June and it was refused. I was told that I need to make an appointment to see a Doctor?....why?
The waiting list is at least 2 weeks! And also means that I will need to book a days leave from work. I keep asking for a prescription but still it gets refused! This has been going on for a month now.
The practice is a shambles complete chaos.

title: Good experience
body: Loving the new approach where a text is sent to give an approximate time of the call from one on the pharmacy team the day before. The 2-6pm thing is unworkable yet a ‘your call will be around 2.15’ respects that your patients are also busy people 👍

title: Excellent service
body: I needed an urgent prescription tbe other week and as it was a Thursday, I knew the surgery would be open until 8pm. I rang about 6.15pm. It didn't take long to get through and the receptionist was very helpful and understanding when I explained my predicament. The Duty Doctor rang me back within 5 minutes and I picked up my prescription at 7.30pm, and was then able to get my much-needed medication from a lat-night chemist. Once again, I find myself very impressed by the service I received. Thanks, once again, Millgate Health Partnership for exceeding my expectations.

title: Great GP service
body: I queried a scan result with one of the relevant GPs at this surgery. I was gobsmacked that the appropriate doctor actually took the time to ring me on my mobile phone and leave a full explanatory message as I thought I'd have to make an appointment. To me, this shows incredible caring and concern and is the level of medical care I've come to expect from this practice in the 30+ years that I've been registered with them. The doctor's voicemail message allayed any concerns I had. Thank you, yet again, for exceeding my expectations.

title: Frustrating phone lines
body:
I have to say up front that the doctors, nurses and customer facing staff are excellent, caring and compassionate. However, like many others commenting on here, they are let down by an awful phone system, which causes much frustration and anxiety when trying to book appointments or just ask a general query. A recent example is when I called the other day just to query a referral which was made 8 months ago. On calling I was advised that I was number 7 in the queue which I thought was reasonable. 55 minutes later I had finally reached number 1 where I remained for another 20 minutes!! At this point I had to hang up as I had an appointment to attend. Surely this can’t be acceptable. What has happened to the call back option which I have used previously, and seemed to work ok? I fully appreciate how busy you all are with how many people are contacting you, but there must be a better way of managing the phone lines. Are there enough staff available to man them? Do the different options offered when calling go to separate lines or are all calls queued on the same line? More than happy to discuss this further if necessary, but look forward to receiving whatever feedback you have. As stated earlier I have no issues with the great service you have kindly provided me with for over 20 years, and thank you all for your kind attentions. 
Regards,
Stephen

title: Equal access to NHS?
body:
There's a reason posters choose to remain anonymous or don't want to contact the ' communications team' - who aren't clinicians and cannot assess the safety of the appointment system. Very few come to here without having told practice staff they're distressed or are having to chase absolutely everything or just can't manage these systems. It's chaotic and I say that as an NHS professional. 
Total triage is obstructive to getting timely care. I am very concerned who is being excluded ( covered by many on here ).
My own story is that like very many my mental health crashed as the pandemic took grip. I can read that I am meant to go to A&E if in danger but I shouldn't reach that point- the whole point of a GP is to prevent serious illness and provide the right type of appt to patients. 
The right type of appt when very depressed is to see a GP in person, not be put through clumsy and sometimes very insensitive reception staff demanding to know every detail and then have to repeat it in a hasty triage appt with a clinician who may well not even be a GP. 
And then for there to be no face to face appts with any GP, let alone one you know.

title: Poor Practise
body:
I'm a Doctor and my experience as a new patient at this practise has been hugely poor across three incidents. 
1) I presented to the practise with an infection. I told my gp I needed medication; however, he didn't listen to my concerns and told me it was autoimmune. My friends and family caught my 'autoimmune' problem and we spent weeks treating it. Something that could have been prevented, but 10 people then caught
2) Recently I had a bone issue and the practise nurse referred me for a 'scan'. I went home expecting this to be an X-ray; however, it turned out to be an ultrasound. This referral was inappropriate and I now need an X-ray, only delaying a diagnosis further
3) I recently called to book an appointment. I was informed I'd get a phone call that afternoon with no specific time. By 6 I'd received no call. I chased the practise but no one answered the phone despite several attempts to call
As someone who holds compassion for colleagues in the NHS, the practise is poor. I look after people''s health and can't even get my own health looked after.

title: Lack of care
body: Had an appointment 4/7/23 and was given a follow up appointment for 7/7/23. Arrived on time for my appointment to be told it was a mistake, it was a phone call not a face to face appointment and someone would call that day. On the NHS app it said 4.20 pm but nobody called. The lack of care at this surgery is appalling. As this is Friday I will now have to wait until Monday to get  any answers.

title: Much better access to services
body:
I would like to say that services for me have improved so much. As most reviews there are a lot of negative ones. I always make my feelings known if I am unhappy and always text the practice manager and my problems were resolved. I have have many instances of good and improved practices recently. I have been able to access an appointment and been surprised that there was an appointment available. I like the reduced info when you first ring to get speak to a receptionist. I like the call back option and the advice to keep dailing. My interaction with the pharmacists are a bit hit and miss, sometimes I get really good helpful advice but sometimes I leave after a fruitless conversation and it makes me very upset. Sometimes they are sometimes so kind and other times seem to be obstructive,
But perhaps there are operational reasons for the difficult outcome. All in all I am glad
To say the service has improved and for my part I am always treated well when dealing with the receptionists. Just one more thing I am not the easiest person to deal with sometimes and I am aware of that. Being a receptionist must be a thankless task sometimes.

title: Patient-centred decision making
body: I recently attended for routine screening including blood tests. The service was friendly and efficient. More importantly, I was contacted promptly after the test results had arrived to discuss the outcomes and suggest changes that I might make to prevent any future health complications. The practitioners listened to my views and worked with me to consider appropriate next steps.

title: Orthopaedic
body: I was discharged from orthopaedics in may after having toe surgery.I am currently still having problems with heeling process and having a lot of problems with pain in the toe and the bone.I am currently waiting for a plastic surgery appointment but heard nothing yet.still having on going bleeding from the wound but pain is the worst and currently taking really strong pain medication.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unnecessary barriers to care
body:
I am a man of over 60 and wanted to arrange some routine blood tests appropriate for my age. My previous surgery had proactively contacted me for this reason.  However I'm now registered with Observatory Practice, and when I sent them an e-consult to ask for the same tests, they wanted instead to arrange a phone call with a doctor.  I arranged this, but they then cancelled it because of a staffing issue and asked me to go through the whole process again.
All a totally unnecessary waste of time!

title: Excellent staff
body: All of the staff were very efficient from the receptionist to the nursing staff, very nice people and showed concern for my injury from the outset. I won't name you individually but you know who you are! 😏.  Thanks again for all your help, it was much appreciated 👍

title: Excellent care
body:
I had a lumpectomy 7July and have experienced nothing but the best care and expertise. Every member of the team went beyond their duty. From being checked in to the day care ward right until discharge. My consultant was there 7am waiting and his registrar also- everything was explained and everyone taking care of me during surgery was introduced. In recovery the nurses were amazingly compassionate and considerate of my needs. I stayed overnight and was told I can leave when I feel ready. 
Thank you to everyone especially breast care team. There are many struggles with the NHS but the staff and care I experienced needs to be recognised.

title: poor outcome
body:
I was taken from my gps surgery by ambulance with very severe back pains. The staff were all great and I had all the usual test in a and e which proved negative but the severe pain continued  .
A consultant said I was to have a back xray then stay in overnight for pain management and perscribed a strong painkiller but the xray department turned down his request. There was no bed - I would have to continue sitting in a chair all night  and no painkiller as I had been perscribed a controlled drug which I couldn't have from a ande. I was taken home shattered and exhausted

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Burnley Practice
body:
Very bad. Appalling.
My screening is done by the receptionist who transmits my health problem to the doctor, it is up to the health professional, even not knowing the extent of the problem, to attend to me or not and this "diagnosis" is transmitted by the receptionist!

title: Disgusting Treatment of Patients
body: Initial appointment went well but downhill since then. Discharged for not attending therapy despite lengthy phonecalls explaining why I couldn't attend those dates. Rang up to discuss discharge to be told I'd receive a call back.  Several months later and still no call back so I ring them to be told I have to go through my gp, triage and mental health assessment again. Seems to me like they just want to get rid of patients as soon as they can to lower the number on their waiting list. Thanks for your lack of support after diagnosing me with multiple mental health problems
